definition[0]: to try to persuade people that a company’s shares are worth more than they really are
example[0]: To ramp up a share price during a takeover bid is unacceptable.
definition[1]: if a company ramps up an activity, it increases it
example[1]: Producers can quickly ramp up production.
definition[2]: if someone ramps up a company’s shares, they try to persuade people that they are worth more than they really are
example[2]: Producers can quickly ramp up production to prevent any shortages.
example[3]: The company spent millions of pounds ramping up its marketing in the US.
example[4]: The strength of the pound sterling has ramped up the cost of imported materials.
